name: stress-ng
description:
stress-ng will stress test a computer system in various selectable ways.
It was designed to exercise various physical subsystems of a computer as
well as the various operating system kernel interfaces.

dependencies.name: libaio
dependencies.description:
Linux native Asynchronous I/O interface library. AIO enables even a
single application thread to overlap I/O operations with other
processing, by providing an interface for submitting one or more I/O
requests in one system call (io_submit()) without waiting for
completion, and a separate interface (io_getevents()) to reap completed
I/O operations associated with a given completion group.

dependencies.name: libbsd
dependencies.description:
This library provides useful functions commonly found on BSD systems,
and lacking on others like GNU systems, thus making it easier to port
projects with strong BSD origins, without needing to embed the same code
over and over again on each project.

dependencies.name: judy
dependencies.description: Judy: General-purpose dynamic array, associative array and hash-trie.

dependencies.name: libatomic-ops
dependencies.description:
This package provides semi-portable access to hardware-provided atomic
memory update operations on a number architectures.

dependencies.name: zlib
dependencies.description:
A free, general-purpose, legally unencumbered lossless data-compression
library.

dependencies.name: keyutils
dependencies.description:
These tools are used to control the key management system built into the
Linux kernel.

dependencies.name: libgcrypt
dependencies.description: Cryptographic library based on the code from GnuPG.

dependencies.name: libcap
dependencies.description:
Libcap implements the user-space interfaces to the POSIX 1003.1e
capabilities available in Linux kernels. These capabilities are a
partitioning of the all powerful root privilege into a set of distinct
privileges.
